citation.article-title: Rhodococcus cercidiphylli sp. nov., a new endophytic actinobacterium isolated from a Cercidiphyllum japonicum leaf

p.s: Description of Rhodococcus cercidiphylli sp. nov.
Rhodococcus cercidiphylli (cer.ci.di.phyl′li. N.L. gen. neut. n. cercidiphylli, of Cercidiphyllum, isolated from Cercidiphyllum japonicum)
Gram-positive, aerobic, non-motile, non-spore-forming, not acid-fast, catalase positive, oxidase negative actinobacterium that shows a rod–coccus life cycle.
Colonies on TSA plates are smooth, opaque and orange in colour.
The NaCl tolerance range is up to 7%.
Negative for Voges-Proskauer and methyl red tests, production of H2S and indole, nitrate reduction, milk coagulation and peptonization.
Tweens 20, 40 and 80 are hydrolyzed, but not gelatin, urea, starch and cellulose.

Positive for β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and β-fucosidase, but negative for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and α-glucosidase.

Utilizes glycerol, d-galactose, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, l-rhamnose, inositol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, arbutin, salicin, d-lactose, d-melibiose, d-saccharose, d-trehalose, d-melezitose, d-raffinose, xylitol, gentiobiose, l-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol and potassium 5-keto-gluconate as sole carbon sources, but erythritol, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, l-xylose, d-adonitol, l-sorbose, dulcitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, esculin, d-cellobiose, d-maltose, inulin, amidon, glycogen, d-turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, potassium gluconate and potassium 2-keto-gluconate are not utilized.
The diagnostic amino acid is meso-diaminopimelic acid, and arabinose and galactose are dominant in whole-cell hydrolysates.
Phospholipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol mannoside, phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylinositol and one unknown phospholipid.
The DNA G+C content is 67.2 mol%.
The type strain, YIM 65003T (=CCTCC AB 207160T=DSM 45141T), was isolated from a surface sterilized leaf sample of C. japonicum collected from Yunnan province, south-west China.
